Defendant who challenges the traffic stop performed by United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge Luis Trevino
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle: White Malibu sedan stopped by United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge Luis Trevino, lacked wind farm sticker and was traveling on Farm-to-Market Road 2050 with out-of-town registration from Hertz Rental Car Company
Defendant who challenges the stop of his vehicle by Officer Reymundo Reyes, displayed extreme nervousness during the stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle: Black Dodge pickup truck stopped by Officer Reymundo Reyes for failing to use a turn signal on Farm-to-Market Road 2050, searched after IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. gave consent, and had conflicting ownership claims
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.undocumented aliens: individuals being transported in vehicles, displaying suspicious behavior such as sitting stiff and not communicating with each other
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle and IGN: Vehicles involved in the incident, including a white Malibu sedan and a black Dodge pickup truck, stopped near the Border Patrol Station Parking Lot, suspected of transporting illegal aliens, both lacked wind farm stickers and were traveling in tandem on Farm-to-Market Road 2050 with out-of-town registrations
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol agent who performed the traffic stop on RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle based on reasonable suspicion due to out-of-town registrations and atypical vehicles for the area, has nearly seven years of experience with the United States Border Patrol
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: Law enforcement agency involved in the incident
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Officer Reymundo Reyes: Freer Police Department officer who stopped IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle and conducted an investigation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marco Montemayor: Special Agent for the United States Department of Homeland Security who interviewed IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Department of Homeland Sec: Law enforcement agency involved in the incident
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle stop: Traffic stop of RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s white Malibu sedan by United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge Luis Trevino on Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle stop: Traffic stop of IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s black Dodge pickup truck on Highway 16 for failing to use a turn signal, where Officer Reymundo Reyes confirmed the license plate matched a BOLO description and questioned IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. about travel plans
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle stop an: Traffic stops of RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s white Malibu sedan and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s black Dodge pickup truck on Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRI: Defendants with motions to suppress recommended for denial by the United States Magistrate Judge, whose driving behavior was observed by United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge Luis Trevino
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol Agent Hugo B: Agent who testified about his uncertainty regarding the arrest of IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.

Individuals involved in a conversation en route to the Border Patrol station, where United States Border Patrol Agent Hugo Benavides allegedly used bad language and made threatening statements to IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo, Texas: Location where Marco Montemayor received a phone call regarding an attempted alien smuggling event
